armGroups.label: Buprenorphine/Nx with SMM

interventions.name: Standard Medical Management (SMM) of Prescription Opiate Abuse
Enhanced Medical Management (EMM) of Prescription Opiate Abuse

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* 18 years old or older
* Physically dependent on opioids
* Meet DSM-IV criteria for opioid dependence

Exclusion Criteria:

* Known allergy or sensitivity to buprenorphine or naloxone
* Unstable psychiatric disorder
* Pregnant or lactating females
* Liver function test results greater than 5 times the upper limit of normal range

outcomeMeasures.title: The Number of Participants Attaining Successful Opioid Use Outcome by Counseling Condition at End of Phase 1
outcomeMeasures.description: In Phase 1, successful outcome was defined as completing week 12 with self-reported opioid use on no more than 4 days in a month, absence of 2 consecutive opioid-positive urine test results, no additional substance use disorder treatment (other than self-help), and no more than 1 missing urine sample during the 12 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Number of Participants Attaining Successful Opioid Use Outcome by Counseling Condition Phase 2, 8-week Posttreatment Follow-up
outcomeMeasures.description: A planned secondary outcome, successful outcome at week 24, that is, 8 weeks after completion of buprenorphine-naloxone taper, was defined the same as at week 12 of Phase 2, that is abstinent from opioids during week 24 and at least 2 of the previous 3 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Number of Participants Attaining Successful Opioid Use Outcomes in Phase 1 by Chronic Pain Condition
outcomeMeasures.description: As a planned secondary analysis, we examined the impact of the two Phase 1 stratification variables on the primary end points. Patients were designated at baseline as having current chronic pain if they reported pain "other than everyday kinds of pain" excluding withdrawal-related pain, for at least 3 months.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Number of Participants Attaining Successful Opioid Use Outcomes in Phase 2 by Chronic Pain Condition
outcomeMeasures.description: As a planned secondary analysis, we examined the impact of the two Phase 1 stratification variables on the primary end points. Patients were designated at baseline as having current chronic pain if they reported pain "other than everyday kinds of pain" excluding withdrawal-related pain, for at least 3 months.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Number of Participants With and Without Any Lifetime Use of Heroin Attaining Successful Opioid Use Outcomes in Phase 1
outcomeMeasures.description: As a planned secondary analysis, we examined the impact of the two phase 1 stratification variables on the primary outcome.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Number of Participants With and Without Any Lifetime Use of Heroin Attaining Successful Opioid Use Outcomes in Phase 2
outcomeMeasures.description: As a planned secondary analysis, we examined the impact of the two phase 1 stratification variables on the primary outcome.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Number of Participants Attaining Successful Opioid Use Outcome by Counseling Condition, Phase 2 End of Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: In phase 2, successful outcome was defined as abstaining from opioids during week 12 (the final week of buprenorphine-naloxone stabilization) and during at least 2 of the previous 3 weeks (weeks 9-11). This outcome measure required substantial improvement but not complete abstinence.
